snippet: Kyrgyz officials said that 55 people were hurt in a remote northern district when officers dispersed protesters threatening to seize a gold mine.
abstract: Kyrgyzstan government declares state of emergency in remote northern district after police officers used tear gas and stun grenades to disperse protesters threatening to seize the country's largest gold mine; 55 people, including 13 police officers, are injured in clashes.
lead_paragraph: Kyrgyz officials said that 55 people were hurt in a remote northern district when officers dispersed protesters threatening to seize a gold mine.

headline.seo: Kyrgyzstan Declares State of Emergency After Clashes
headline.main: Kyrgyzstan Declares State of Emergency After Clashes
